reference_a:
@article{kuczynski2022,
  title = {The effect of social interaction quantity and quality on depressed mood and loneliness: {{A}} daily diary study},
  shorttitle = {The effect of social interaction quantity and quality on depressed mood and loneliness},
  author = {Kuczynski, Adam M. and Halvorson, Max A. and Slater, Lily R. and Kanter, Jonathan W.},
  date = {2022-03-01},
  journaltitle = {Journal of Social and Personal Relationships},
  volume = {39},
  number = {3},
  pages = {734--756},
  publisher = {SAGE Publications Ltd},
  issn = {0265-4075},
  doi = {10.1177/02654075211045717}
}

features.name: depressed
features.coding:
I felt down, depressed, or hopeless today
0 = None of the time
10 = All of the time

features.name: anhedonia
features.coding:
I had little interest or pleasure in doing things today
0 = None of the time
10 = All of the time

features.name: loneliness
features.coding:
I felt lonely today
0 = Not at all
10 = Extremely

features.name: left_out
features.coding:
I felt left out today
0 = Not at all
10 = Extremely

features.name: social_interaction
features.coding:
How much social interaction did you have today?
0 = None at all
10 = A lot

features.name: vulnerability
features.coding:
I expressed my true feelings to others today
0 = Not at all
5 = A moderate amount
10 = Very much so

features.name: perceived_responsiveness
features.coding:
I felt understood/cared for by others today
0 = Not at all
10 = Extremely
